thread.title: On second thought, OneRepublic will not perform an LSU halftime show
thread.title_full: On second thought, OneRepublic will not perform an LSU halftime show

title: On second thought, OneRepublic will not perform an LSU halftime show
text:
On second thought, OneRepublic will not perform an LSU halftime show On second thought, OneRepublic will not perform an LSU halftime show Photo by Eric Risberg -- OneRepublic perform at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium in San Francisco in early September. The band will not perform at the LSU-Florida halftime show. Advocate staff report Comments 
OneRepublic will not perform in Tiger Stadium on Saturday, Oct. 17. 
The band’s appearance was scheduled for halftime of the LSU-Florida game. According to LSU and the show promoter, College Live, the parties were “unable to abide by the contractual terms.” 
In an alternate universe, the entire LSU fanbase telephoned OneRepublic singer Ryan Tedder and said, “It’s too late to apologize.” 
The halftime performance featuring Aloe Blacc with the Tiger Band at the LSU-Arkansas game on Nov. 14 will go on as scheduled. 
LSU is considering another halftime show for a future game in Tiger Stadium, the university said. Get The Advocate in your inbox
